website_summaries.verdict: Many TV/snack trays do not fit snugly under a bed or sofa, but this one will slide easily under a couch or recliner, allowing a closer fit while dining, gaming, or crafting.
pros: Generous dimensions for computer and gaming use
Easy to assemble, no tools required
cons: Cup holder has quality control issues
Some sagging under minimal load reported

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice table but the cup holder is a worthless piece of junk that broke the first day.
customer_reviews.text: It's ashamed that such a nice little table was fitted with such a poorly made cup holder. The table is sturdy, decent looking and has good height and angle adjustability. However, I placed a 24 ounce glass bottle of beverage in the cup holder and by the end of the first day the cup holder had cracked and was no longer usable. Not worth sending back and so I'll keep it. But you would think that the guy that created, patented, and clearly takes a lot of pride in his creation (check out the product website) would have spent a bit more time making sure that the cup holder wasn't such a worthless piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph & Lydia

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is not very sturdy, wobbles a lot. It also sags without much weight (see attached picture with a yardstick across the table). It sags about an inch especially on the end with the cup holder. I would like it better without the cup holder, which also is not very sturdy. I am still using it though and it is handy for a laptop but is too wobbly to eat a meal on. But for the price I am still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nannabug

customer_reviews.title: The table and leg configuration are great. The slide out drink hold is ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: The table and leg configuration are great. The slide out drink hold is ridiculous. The manufacturer had an opportunity to create a solid, sturdy cup holder during engineering and the manufacturing process. Instead they created a drink holder the bends under the slightest weight and is not safe enough as a drink holder for many drinks and certain weights.
customer_reviews.author: nomdeplume

customer_reviews.title: Very Functional and Space Saving
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this table for my mother who lives with my husband and I. The table is great! It's sturdy and the angles that it can change to are good as well. Love the cup holder but I wish it was a little wider to be able to fit a standard size glass/cup. The base only fits a narrow glass/cup. Also love that you can slide the legs up under the couch so it's not a tripping hazard.
customer_reviews.author: DIANTHA

customer_reviews.title: The concept is good, but it's just a matter of time before ...
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY THIS! I purchased this table for my elderly mother so that she could use it to eat her meals on while watching TV. It is the flimsiest piece of plastic I have ever seen. The concept is good, but it's just a matter of time before her entire meal ends up in her lap. Oh, and the cup holder??? What a joke. Certainly not worth the $39.95 that I paid for it. Probably going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen  Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Well the cat approves
customer_reviews.text: Flimsier than I would have liked. I also wish I had gotten the black, I think it would have been a little more current. The tan color just looks very outdated to me. All in all, it serves it’s purpose and it is easy to fold up and slide under my sofa. Serves well as a cat perch too :)
customer_reviews.author: S. SmithTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does what it advertises with a catch.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to. I'm not sure if mine is just a fluke but it's very wobbly. The legs are very very unstable. But as long as you don't put alot of weight on the table it will hold up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Bowling

customer_reviews.title: Smaller, but easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. The table is smaller in width than implies in the ad photos, but it does hold my laptop with the mouse next to it. The shipping packaging was very sparse, though it arrived undamaged. It was easy to put together, no tools needed. You will need hand and finger strength to snap everything into place, so if you have arthritis you will need help with this. I do like the separate legs, it makes it easy to slide back and forth when sitting in a chair or couch.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Not stable
customer_reviews.text: This tray is awful. I'm not sure why so many like it. It tips over so easily. The bracket that holds the actual top in its upright position does not lock in place so it is always falling down. It is hard/awkward to stow away because the l-shaped legs always seem to get in the way. Finally, when you do get it into its usable position, it is not stable at all. We are returning this product and going back to just basic wooden TV trays .
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Probst

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but make the mext model taller.
customer_reviews.text: I love this table, and how smooth it slides on the carpet. I would give it 5 stars if it adjusted just a bit higher so I could use it in bed to hold my coffee while studying... it wont slide over my legs cause our mattress is too high. But if you want it for the couch or a very low bed, its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Scribner

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this without reading the review.
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this a one star because I can't give this a 0 star rating. This is the biggest piece of s### that I've ever purchased online. 100% bonafide, totally conclusive trash. I literally can't say enough bad things about this product. 1. The table doesn't sit level 2. The cup holder will only hold a sippe cup or the smallest bottle of water available. 3. It's mostly junk. There's nothing convenient about the storage or fold up process 4. Instructions are horrible 5. Even on level surface it's not very level or balanced 6. A complete Rip off price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay folding tray table. It's a little flimsy and when you put something a little heavy on the table it feels like it is about to tip over. Also, the tilt mechanism doesn't really allow you tilt it very much forward. This is important if you are looking at a large book and want to bring the table forward to someone sitting in a recliner. The slide away cup holder is ok, but does not have a lot of flexibility to hold something a little large. The folding mechanism to fold the table down works well and it is easy to fold it and put it away. My biggest complaint is this is not a very sturdy table
customer_reviews.author: PSG

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my 82 year old mother.It is not sturdy at all ! It does slide easily on her carpet but do to the lack of stability she unfortunately can not use it.Disappointing!!! Will continue to try & find her a good sturdy TV tray she can use!
customer_reviews.author: Sas

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!! Rip off! Garbage!! Don’t waste your $$
customer_reviews.text: Where to start.... bought two tables hoping they would suit our needs. They came together easily but they are very flimsy! Slightest bump and it falls down!!! Very shameful to sell these at $40 a piece when you can’t even put a plate of food in it! Really!!!? What a rip off and don’t get me started with the cup holders either! Garbage folks don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected!
customer_reviews.text: This product appeared very "cheap" once it was set-up. Not as expected. It was immediately returned. If you need a classy-looking table, this is not it, however, if you just need something functional, then this may be the table for you.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE, EASY, AWESOME.
customer_reviews.text: NEEDED A WORKTABLE THAT WOULD WORK WITH MY SOFA FOR ALL-DAY TELEWORKING. THE LEGS SLIDE RIGHT UNDER MY COUCH THANKS TO THE "l" SHAPE THEY HAVE. CAN ADJUST HEIGHT AND TILT, AND HAS RIGHT HAND CUP HOLDER (IT DOES NOT MOVE TO LEFT SIDE). NO TOOLS REQUIRED FOR ASSEMBLY, EASY TO UNDERSTAND INSTRUCTIONS AND ASSEMBLED IN LESS THAN 5 MINUTES. DON'T EXPECT IT TO HOLD TOO MUCH -- IN VOLUME OR IN WEIGHT. IT HOLDS MY LAPTOP AND SEPARATE KEYBOARD AND THAT'S ALL I NEEDED IT TO DO. SLIDES/GLIDES IN OR OUT LIKE A DREAM WHEN YOU NEED TO GET UP/SIT DOWN.
customer_reviews.author: L. K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very wobbly!
customer_reviews.text: Unstable, very wobbly. Cup holder is useless, too flimsy to hold anything but a paper cup with an ounce of liquid. Seems like an additional piece to brace the legs would solve wobble. The plastic top is cheap looking and feeling. I'm very disappointed in this product. Found a smaller, more stable similar item for less than half the price at a famous big box supercenter (you know the one I mean!)
customer_reviews.author: Kip

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the one I bought years ago but still a great product
customer_reviews.text: About 15 years ago I bought a Tablemate in simulated wood (which is no longer sold). I decided to buy a new one because the old one started to bow in from use and the top started to chip. Also the new version has a slide out cup holder which is really great, albeit a little flimsy. I also noticed that the entire table isn't nearly as stable as my old table. I have to be careful when I move it towards me and it wobbles. However, I still like it MUCH better than a TV tray. I just wish it was more stable and the cup holder was a a little more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: Aki

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Set Up But Not Stable
customer_reviews.text: The issue with this basket is that it doesn't clamp particularly securely so it is prone to just tipping off the walker. The two things which attach to the walker aren't adjustable at all so essentially one is just relying on the hook type of device which renders it unstable. I wouldn't want to use it for anything that could break or spill because of the instability. I have a pretty standard walker but there isn't anything below where the clamps hit that really provide a solid grip nor is there a way to adjust them so there is a tighter fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amarante

customer_reviews.title: Overall, pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I've actually tried pretty hard to find a way to write a good review for these trays, but they just barely meet even a single requirement for this type of product. Yes, they create a surface upon which you can eat. However, that surface, while stable enough to not fall over, shifts under the pressure of a fork pushing into a piece of meat. I haven't done weight testing, though I would guess roughly two pounds would bend these trays by several degrees. They are fairly easy to set up and store. Seriously though, the cup holder is ornamental at the very best. It could barely hold up an empty Styrofoam cup.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tray to hold my laptop while working in my recliner in the living room. It's not as tall or as sturdy as I had hoped but I can work around that. The biggest problem is that the lip around the tray is not very tall and it's rounded so my laptop slides off with the slightest tilt. Therefore, unless I use it completely flat, which is uncomfortable for typing, it's pretty much useless. I guess I can duct tape something onto it to hold up my laptop but don't know how long that will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Adjustments are highly annoying
customer_reviews.text: Good idea and certain features are nice such as the legs and feet allow one to pull the tray completely onto their lap while seated. However, if you are familiar with them, the height adjustment and leg folding function are accomplished by little spring loaded ball bearing stops that pop into holes in the legs. They are very annoying which leads to leaving it out and not stowing it away which obviously defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last.
customer_reviews.text: I use this tray on a daily basis and I just love it. Fits well under my bed or chair, tilts just right and the cup holder is handy. Seems a little fragile so I wouldn't jump up and down on it but I eat off it, use it for my laptop, and even prop my feet on it sometimes. All around useful. Now that I've had the tray for 10 months a major defect has occurred. The tray has developed a bow in the middle and everything slides towards the middle. I would not buy this tray again and only wish I could return for a refund but that is just wishful thnking.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Table for Casual Use
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Adjustable height. - Support legs fit easily under most furniture. - Table slides away and back into position very easily. Cons: - As seen in the photos the tabletop is often marked during the production process in patterns matching the underside supports. The manufacturer does not consider this a flaw in the product, but it's a bit unsightly, thus 3 stars. - The TM II doesn't fit much beyond a laptop; the XL provides additional space for a book or papers, etc. on the work surface. - The leg supports cannot slide under a sofa that is not raised sufficiently off the floor - check your furniture!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and useful
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little tables, especially for remote learning. We don't have room for desks for all our kids and now two of them are in remote school for three days a week. These little tables are great for a chromebook, some papers and pencils, and multiple sizes of kid. Can be tall enough for my senior, but adjusts to short enough for my sixth grader. The cupholder is flimsy but it's just fine for a water bottle which is all they're allowed to have in the living room anyway. The tables are easy to put away when not needed and were easy for the boys to assemble themselves. Worth the extra money for these nicer tables over a traditional TV tray.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as my last TableMate
customer_reviews.text: This table is very easy to assemble and slides very nicely across the floor. Beyond that it leaves somethings to be desired. The available angles of the table top are off. The "flat" position is actually slightly higher in the front than in the back making it awkward to use. The next position down is nice for reading a book, but if you have anything else on the table it slides off. It would seem easy to put a higher lip on the lower edge of the table. The third position down is useless. The rod that provides the positions easily disengages from its clip. My last tablemate was sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but a little wobbly.
customer_reviews.text: The table went together easily and I quick to fold and set up again. As advertised it does slide easily across our carpet, even with a laptop on it. The cup holder must be designed for a small paper cup because it won't hold any of the glasses or mugs we own. I really expected a normal 12 oz can to fit in it, but even that is too large. I wouldn't trust a beverage on top of the table because it is quite wobbly. It works to hold a laptop or a tablet or even a plate as long as you don't mind side to side wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Green

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw. The wobbliest tray table you'll ever own!
customer_reviews.text: Adjusted rating-Because the table below fixes all the problems: Adjustable TV Tray Table - TV Dinner Tray on Bed & Sofa, Comfortable Folding Table with 6 Height & 3 Tilt Angle Adjustments by HUANUO  The above table by HUANUO has a bar between legs that eliminates wobbles and the rod for table support clicks firmly into place. picture shows both tables after I picked them up by the edge and moved them close to dresser Remember to pick up feet when sliding away or slide will be stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Great option!
customer_reviews.text: My mother recently entered an assisted living facility, then Covid hit and all the residents had to eat in their rooms. She didn't like the TV tray she had to eat from because she couldn't sit close enough to the tray to eat without dropping some because the tray had the traditional cross section legs where your feet are. This model was just what she needed! There is no middle bar at the bottom that interferes with her feet and the legs slide easily under the chair. She can pull it closer or move it further away without any problems. The surface is also larger than traditional TV trays and the cup holder is an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: easy to move about
customer_reviews.text: we had the traditional wooden trays if you move it the wrong way it could collapse with food on it! we have a carpeted family room where these slide easily out of the way if you needed to go get something else for your meal. it has a cup holder. a lip on the tray keeps spills on the trey. the height adjustment is awesome. ALSO makes it really easy to put your iPad on there with your phone and do some work. they snuggle up nicely to our furniture. they take a few more steps to break down and put away. but because we have found them so easy to use for multiple purposes we hardly break them down.
customer_reviews.author: H. madden

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed, I was so excited to be getting this ...
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed, I was so excited to be getting this tray. I am disabled and spend a great deal of time sitting on my couch. I thought this would be perfect for everything from meals to crafts and crosswords to working on the laptop. Unfortunately, it is not very sturdy at all and as such I am not comfortable leaving my laptop sit on it if I need to walk away for a moment. Think hard before you spend this much money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a laptop desk for my wife to use when eating in the living room. She couldn't seem to keep it flat and ended up with spaghetti in her lap. This TV tray is exactly what we needed. It's sturdy but lightweight. It's easy to adjust to the height and angle needed. It's easy within a tight space to slide the legs under the couch and into position. I like the cup feature that slides out from the side though a can of soda sometimes fits too snugly and the cup inside the holder comes out with the soda can.
customer_reviews.author: twseid58

customer_reviews.title: Serves a purpose if not looking for sturdy
customer_reviews.text: While we kept the table because it is exactly what we wanted (ability to put under couch and raise/lower to different heights) I do not trust it. The table rocks back and forth when you place something on it and if it is bumped it moves too easily. This is great for miscellaneous stuff on it next to the coach but I don’t trust it for food and water (although there is a lip around the whole thing just in case something spills).
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Sheriff

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: The tables are not very sturdy at all. The plastic table top and metal legs are very flimsy. I like that you can adjust the height of the table and the tilt of the table top, but overall I would definitely not recommend these. Cheaply made. Folding them is also a hassle but I do appreciate that they fold down relatively flat, it just takes a minute or two to get it set up again or to fold down. Quite the contraption, but again glad it’s able to lay flat one folded down.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Great little table/work space
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit wobbly but it’ll do the job. I got a great deal from Amazon Warehouse. You never know if the items will be very damaged or they’re just returns. I think mine was a simple return. It didn’t show any signs of wear. Very easy to put together, it took like 5 minutes at most. I wish the cup holder was wider for bigger cups but not a big deal. It’s perfect for soda cans. What most attracted me to it is the small indentation along the border that way if I’m working with beads or anything that might roll off it won’t.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a hospital-style table, but has several other uses
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this as a table to go over the lap of my husband (who recently had surgery), to keep his laptop off his lap when recovering in bed (we don't have a desk at home). It also works if you are sitting on the sofa, as a laptop table, or a table for lunch, and I have been using it for my coloring books. The height is easily adjustable, as are the different angles you can set it at. It is not the most sturdy table out there, but for the price and how much we have used it during coronavirus lockdown, this is a good little purchase. And it folds flat for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: I really like it, but it isn't very liquid friendly.
customer_reviews.text: (I'm editing my review due to an issue I've discovered.) While setup was a breeze and I use it really often, it's way too easy to bump and jiggle anything on the table. I've knocked over too many mugs and glasses of beverages simply by lightly bumping the table, not to mention spilling things in a bowl. Today I lost an entire cup of tomato soup when I bumped the tray a little. It's a nice little tray, but if you don't use the cup holder for some reason I'd think multiple times before putting anything liquid on it.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Extra table for grandson
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a sturdy and portable table that would fold down easily for when my grandson comes to visit. He's 6. Playing Uno with him is fun, but putting the cards down on the couch with a kid jumping around in excitement didn't make for a good game. This thing did the trick. Very little bumping into it, sturdy, easy to scoot in between us on the couch. I'm happy. And an added bonus is he could put his snacks on it while we're playing.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Diva

customer_reviews.title: Not prettiest thing but works and can be flimsy
customer_reviews.text: We use this as a laptop stand or dinner tray when sitting on the couch. It's functional but not necessarily a design addition to the room. It folks up easily but you have to be careful with the tray b/c the arm that holds it up does not lock and therefore easy to flip up when you stand up and knock everything off the surface. Because of the design, it's also easy to knock the whole thing over, so you have to hold down on the ends of the tray legs (with your feet) to make sure the whole thing doesn't pitch forward when you're sitting at it.
customer_reviews.author: Indie Film Fan

customer_reviews.title: This thing will make u crazy
customer_reviews.text: This thing will make you crazy. First of all if you look at it the wrong way the legs go flying off in a different direction. It does have multiple levels which is nice and the ability to pull it up close to you whether you’re in bed or a couch. Which is nice. But putting it together to use or taking it down from being used is very difficult and requires an octopus style amount of hands.
customer_reviews.author: Nick gilroy

customer_reviews.title: Wobble? Yes. Still 5
customer_reviews.text: I read the mixed reviews and will add my own mixed, but still 5 review. Does it wobble? Yes, but If it's adjusted low, the wobble is tolerable; in fact, if you can squeeze it up between the arm rests, it doesn't wobble at all. That procedure worked for two of our recliners and still left room for our legs. It slides easily under the recliners. We've used both trays now for several weeks. Haven't used the cup-holders. Haven't had need to fold the trays. You do have to make sure the bar that allows the table top to slant is pushed firm in to the holder slots. Learned that the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: H, Phillips

customer_reviews.title: great concept but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: A Great concept, but these are very flimsy and light. They're too easy to tip over. If they were a bit heavier and sturdier, they would be great. If we bump them with our legs or our small dog bumps them, the whole thing nearly tips over. Also the pegs in the hole in the legs may fall out. Our pup found one, chewed it up, and almost swallowed it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sykes

customer_reviews.title: Kinda like a school desk, but in a GOOD way
customer_reviews.text: It's always been a hassle to eat in the living room - balancing dishes and glasses and/or having to lean forward to reach the coffee table have not been good for the rug. The legs of these tables slide way under one's seat to bring the surface in close, making them a safe, convenient, comfortable and FUN place to eat, drink, read, color, compute, etc. To me, they have the feeling of a school desk... Nice that they fold up easily for storage, but we haven't done so yet. They're constantly in use. (I should mention that they're a bit wobbly... but we don't care.)
customer_reviews.author: Cape Cod Kadi

customer_reviews.title: Great for disabled
customer_reviews.text: This table is absolutely perfect for my daughter with disabilities at her rocker recliner chair! The legs fit under the chair on our wood floor and can slide all the way to her so she doesn't spill food. She likes the drink holder too. I then fold it easily to hide right next to her chair between the chair and side table when not using it.
customer_reviews.author: S and S in WA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable table with exceptional customer service!
customer_reviews.text: + Solid construction ( except the cup holder ) + Easy to fold and stash under a couch or bed ( needs 3 inches clearance ) + Variable height adjustment/tilt angles great for laptop, reading, writing or simply using it for meals. ++ Stellar customer service! My shipment was missing the plastic bottom for the cupholder, and rather than just send a replacement piece, Becca in customer service simply sent out another table for no additional cost! It is obvious that the Doug Soper and his crack customer service team truly believes in this product and stands by it 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Faisal Humayun

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and an upgrade from conventional TV tray
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a conventional TV tray in front of my recliner and the Table Mate is a definite upgrade. I can sit all the way back in my recliner now instead of leaning forward. The adjustable height and slant of the Table Mate are compatible with both my laptop and eating. It was easy to assemble (no tools needed). I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DLK from Corona, CA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height compared to regular T.V. trays!
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable height makes all the difference. Plus, it can be easily used alongside a chair or bed, the way it's designed to have the bottom support slip underneath the furniture or bed. It is jiggly- stable if trying to cut food on your plate that is on the tray. The tray wiggles and bounces, but it is definitely stable enough that the tray won't tip over. Easy to adapt to this slight issue. We LOVE the tray, and use it regularly. We'll buy another.
customer_reviews.author: N. M.

customer_reviews.title: Total Crap
customer_reviews.text: I'm wondering if the overwhelming number of positive reviews on this piece of junk are fakes. The thing is incredibly flimsy, totally unstable, and wiggles at the slightest tough. .If you try to move it at all, the metal brace that holds the tray part up comes loose and everything on the table falls to the floor. This includes food trays, books, and $1200 laptop computers. Terrible product! Would never recommend to anyone unless you actually WANT your laptop to fall off and break. I can't stress enough how horrible this product is.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Good side table, fairly sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This table is nice, put together real easy & is very adjustable for height as well as the tilt of the table. I agree, the cup holder is not sturdy at all, hence the 4 star rating on sturdiness overall, but I didn't buy it to use that anyway. Price was pretty good too, as it helped me with holiday stuff during my disability issues this year.
customer_reviews.author: catgirl74

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t hold up to using my laptop (typical size laptop...nothing ridiculous) on it. It bends and collapses. I bought it to use for my laptop (which I just set on this product, to hold the laptop, as I have the laptop hooked to a TV with an HDMI cord, so the picture is bigger and easier to see, and easier to work from). So it’s not holding much at all. And the laptop has a fan that keeps it cool, so it doesn’t even get warm at all. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jayden B.

customer_reviews.title: Not a sturdy table
customer_reviews.text: Received item very fast, easy to assemble but I did notice it appeared as though it had been put together prior to me receiving due to scratches and wear on areas. The idea of this table is fantastic and I was so happy to find a table to help my grandmother, but it won’t be this table. This table is EXTREMELY unsturdy for use, and the table top will fall down with the slight touch in the wrong area. For $40 I absolutely believe this table could be more dependable. And I will most certainly be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product-A bit overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a “desk” in a classroom setting in an auditorium. Worked very well. A little clumsy to take down and reassemble. You have to fiddle somewhat with the buttons to adjust the height. FORGET the cup holder. I wouldn’t trust that cheap part of it with any kind of drink. Otherwise the table works just fine. I also use it at home. Unlike the ‘old’ style TV tray this slides under even low sitting sofas so you can have the table right up to where you want it. A bit overpriced for the quality but I think worth it if it fills the need.
customer_reviews.author: sharonwilsh

customer_reviews.title: Decent surface area but lightweight materials make this somewhat not sturdy enough to use as desk.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 91 yr old mother to use in her room since the covid-19 has all residents in her facility restricted to their rooms. Lightweight makes it easily for her to move around but also is not that sturdy. She finds trying to use as a writing table too flimsy. However the tray area is large so she can easily eat from it where more sturdier wood frame or metal frame tables are too narrow or weight to much for her to move easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Broden

customer_reviews.title: This concept works great but....
customer_reviews.text: Ok, it does exactly what I need it to do. It is my new COVID desk for work. But it could easily be soooo much better with the manufacturer making some improvements. The top needs to be thicker and more robust, and when leaning on it, it does flex a lot. The top is a slick plastic surface and my MacBook slides on it when on a decline position. A rubberized top would be nice. Overall it does what it needs to and being able to pull it to me (sliding under the couch) is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly
customer_reviews.text: It wobbles, even when I tried to put it over the couch arm. That's because it doesn't go over the couch arm even when I adjusted the height. I wondered why pictures showed smiling people sitting at the ends of their couches with the trays in front of them. What was because the tray didn't fit the couch and that was the closest they could get to the.tray. I have some black accents in the room, but that tray was so ugly it didn't blend with anything. I really didn't think it would be so ugly when I ordered it. Thank you Amazon for refunding my money so quickly when I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: SoontobeMimi

customer_reviews.title: Great as long as you know what you're getting
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a quick and easy to assemble piece. I needed something that could be easily disassembled when needed, I didn't want a permanent fixture iny home. Going to use it occasionally, and put it away when I have company (I have a really small place). It's not meant for a heavy load. It is a little wobbly. But it holds a regular laptop and a drink just fine. It's perfect for my needs. Especially for the price. The C-shape is great so you can slide it right up to you on the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Working at Home
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter had to move back home with us because of the pandemic. But her old room didn't have enough space for a regular desk. To get her work done she had to work at the dining room table. This folding desk lets her work in her room and she is more productive and very much happier. Plus the desk has a cup holder, which I thought was superfluous, but our daughter uses it constantly. This folding desk is just what she needed.
customer_reviews.author: johnson86

customer_reviews.title: I dig it, but it is a bit unstable and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I really like how the legs can slide under my chair and the adjustable height makes it versatile. However, it seems pretty unstable, on lament and carpet. If you only place a plate and drink, and you don’t accidentally hit it, it’s totally fine. Just don’t bump it. Folding it back up can be a challenge. Putting the tray part down makes it unstable, and it will fall over. The move the legs in to fold it flat requires a decent grip strength. I don’t find it too hard to squeeze the legs in, but someone like my grandma definitely cannot. Overall I’m satisfied with it, but know what you’re buying to manage your expectations.
customer_reviews.author: morgan henderson

customer_reviews.title: very unstable
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, I found stability to be a problem. Am able to place hand weights on legs when placed under a chair or couch, but I should not have to. Perhaps filling the bottom legs that slide under chair with sand or small pebbles would help, or draping wrist/ankle weights over them. Seems dangerous for a child or elderly person to use w/out supervision; table top would not support much weight should they attempt to use for leverage to stand. Not worth the cost to return to seller. Good idea, but requires better execution for safety.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE TABLE!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth Table Mate of one size or another. Some people have complained that they wobble. Yes, they move a little, but it’s only because of their unique construction that makes them so very versatile! They are actually VERY sturdy. I use one totally as my laptop table because I can drop it to just the right height for my 5ft tall body. It’s the first table I’ve ever found that allows me to adjust it low enough to be comfortable for me. I like it so much that I just bought this one to be shipped to my sister so I’ll have a laptop table when I visit her soon. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Emeles

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: It wasn’t what I was looking for. I have those wooden ones that that you sort of open then then fold and sit on 4 points on the ground and I was looking for something taller to be able to eat with my new couch that sits up higher. This felt more “hospital” like. I suppose it would be good for someone in bed but I didn’t enjoy eating regular meals on it. I was afraid I would lean on it or put too much weight and it would collapse all the time. Even the white plastic made it feel cheap or like for someone in bed rest or something.
customer_reviews.author: Mr White

customer_reviews.title: lOVE THESE TRAYS
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these tv trays for my laptop for years. Just got my hubby one to use as a tv tray and he loves it. So much better than a regular tv tray. Easier to clean also. No metal around the edges to get rusty and smelly. Also can adjust the height. This is our third one which I use to do diamond painting. The top tilts just right and the edge holds stops the artist light with the diamond painting on from slipping off. Just a great all around tray.
customer_reviews.author: Gabbie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to assemble. Parts appear well made, but table design is very unstable side-to-side. It has a nice feature for holding a drink but I wouldn't recommend using it because of this instability. Table surface of plastic is a bit thin so don't put any significant weight on it. Overall I would recommend purchasing a quality wooden folding tray that would provide much better stability and weight carrying capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Roamer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution if you eat/work in front of the TV
customer_reviews.text: We use these in front of the TV almost every night. Super easy to assemble. More than easy to fold....as sometimes when we grab to move them they fold flat. Haven't tried the cup holder. Not sure it is sturdy enough, and there is plenty of room on the surface for dinner and a drink. Love the height adjustment and tilt. I contemplated the larger size, but this is more than sufficient for TV dining needs with room for drinks, phone, remotes.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wharton

customer_reviews.title: Work well but very ugly
customer_reviews.text: These looked good when I was searching on Amazon. They work pretty well but my wife hates them as they are very ugly. When you put the flat surface down to stack in a corner, they are not well balanced and fall down. Bottom line is they work as advertised but I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Marshall

customer_reviews.title: The thing wobbles!
customer_reviews.text: I sometimes use this table for eating my meals. My complaint about this table is that it is extremely unstable. Because it wobbles so much I don't put any drinks on it, so that makes the cup holder pretty much worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Ki49er

customer_reviews.title: Handy but saggy.
customer_reviews.text: Table is quite handy and this is the second one I’ve bought. I have the same problem with both. The top bends and warps and can’t be fixed. The middle and sides sag and make it hard for taller things to stay upright. It’s good that it’s bend but don’t break as it will last for years, but it will be saggy for the same amount of time. Meant for light duty. I use it to eat off every day. Plates, bowls, water bottle means droop.
customer_reviews.author: Melmobabee

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit nervous from reading reviews but this works pretty well for my needs. I did take off a star because it is overpriced IMO, but it was the best option for my needs. Only minor gripe is that my laptop would slide off if I put it on an angle, which was most comfortable. It would be great if there was a tab that could lift up for that purpose. I was able to work on my laptop all day and no issues. It didn’t wobble or feel like it was gonna fall, but I pushed it away before getting up
customer_reviews.author: Bianca ReaganTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Basic lightweight folding table
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic but handy lightweight folding table. It can fit a dinner plate with flatware and a salad bowl or several small snack dishes. The height is adjustable which is a plus. We got this for our seasonal renters and it does the job and is easy to fold up and store away.
customer_reviews.author: SMCT

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This product is simple to assemble. But, wobbles like crazy. I didn't realized that this was going to be all plastic that feels and is cheap. The platform is alittle weak and there isn't allot of stability. This is mainly while the legs are extended, not on my lap. I use this while sitting in my living room for my laptop. The cup holder doesn't even stay in place in it's slot...keeps falling out. Not worth the $$
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: It serves it's purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Since I'm now working from home due to COVID-19, I needed more desk space for paperwork and wanted something black to match my furniture. This totally serves it's purpose as the height is adjustable and there is ample table-top space. It's not the most sturdy piece of furnitue, but I dont think it ever claimed to be. I'm not using the cup holder as I didn't purchase it for that reason (even though the cup holder got bad reviews). Overall, it's a decent price for a functional piece of furniture. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: David Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and adjust
customer_reviews.text: Just received the product, had it assembled in less than two minutes, using it shortly after. Only issue is with the cup holder. The initial hole is big enough to fit a standard 12oz can, but the insert inside it is not, so only the bottom 1/2 inch of the can will go in the cup holder. Not a real problem, but thought it should be mentioned. On the whole, this does everything I wanted it to, and I am happy with the purchase. If after a few meals my opinion changes I will update my review to reflect new thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: this only way to contact Amazon !
customer_reviews.text: to Actually the table was not as sturdy for everyday use as desk and eating table but can't get ahold of Amazon to solve other problems. Guess they are now to big so they only answer questions they have answers in a can. Fortunatly Walmart and Target are starting to compete and have call in person for customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. I have to say that I am torn about reviewing this product. There is nothing wrong with it. It works well. It is more sturdy than it looks, but then I haven’t overloaded it either. I guess I would have liked a wooden product, but then I didn’t “pay “ that kind of money for one! But overall it doesn’t look bad and it works well. I would recommend for the price and simple functionality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was planning to use this for my meals in front of the TV. Worked quite well though I had to be quite careful not to shake while cutting food. It was not as steady as I would have liked. The cup holder is a plus. Not sure if it will be steady enough for long computer usage. Table shakes too much.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Diane

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s cheaper and not as solid as I had hoped. Have to be extremely careful when moving it because the bar that holds the angle of the table slides out easily and food or drinks go crashing. The idea of the table is nice as legs are widespread with no crossbar so the table can literally slide right to you when sitting in recliner for example. Also convenient to use as side table. The drink compartment is useless
customer_reviews.author: Sally Fields Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: I would consider this an average product. Folding table is pretty flimsy. You can hardly rest your arms on the edges without it falling back toward you. Sturdy enough for a plate and food, but don't expect it to be sturdy enough to hold a laptop and have your hands and wrist resting on the edge (or it will start falling toward you). Not a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Super flimsy and not stable at all
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together but, I set a cup of tea on it and it and it started tipping over. I lowered it two notches hoping that being lower would make it more stable, nope. The whole point of a tray like this is to be able to put things on it and feel that they're secure and stable during use but, this is not that. Need to try to send these back.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Slanted backwards
customer_reviews.text: I got this table to do crafts on. I am currently doing felt Halloween ornaments. The table when put in the position to be level with sitting, goes up at the part nearest you. So that the table is actually slanted backwards. This is very frustrating when working with beads and sequins, they roll away from you. I put an 8 pound weight on it, hoping it would fix it but it did not.
customer_reviews.author: sews

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!
customer_reviews.text: This table is VERY small. Too small, in fact, for a laptop and enough room to move the mouse. The construction is also VERY flimsy. It can be hard to tell about quality until you receive the item. I immediately returned the table and got dinged $10 in return shipping to add insult to injury.
customer_reviews.author: hakkdad

customer_reviews.title: Great Table
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this table for an elderly lady for her room. The height is great when sitting in a chair and be adjusted to 3 levels for her the 3rd level works great. She uses it for eating small meals and reading of books. The only negative is the cup holder. It will not hold a coffee mug but will hold small bottles of water. Great product for senior people, but must be careful not to use when getting up it is not intended for that . Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what you would expect for the money, but if you put any weight on it, for example, your elbows with the weight, it could break. Last night I used it to eat diner on -it was a disaster! If you eat anything you have to cut -meat, it won't go well. I went to eat a steak last night and at first cut, my drink flew off the table and spilt everywhere. The table wobbled SO MUCH, I COULDN'T USE IT TO EAT.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it folds up to fit under couch. Also that it slides nicely under your knees and adjustable height. Cup holder is basically useless since it is not sturdy enough that I would trust us to hold a liquid, but I didn't buy it for the cup buy it for the cup holder. I think for what it is, it is very overpriced. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: avoid
customer_reviews.text: The legs on mine were so wobbly and the whole thing wobbled would not put much weight on it either. Feels like cheap and plastic is not good. cup holder is just a little cup that sits on a hole hard to put away. Buy your grandparents/parents something better
customer_reviews.author: Tough customer (Arthur ref)

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2, liked them so much we bought 2 more. We have a lovely dining set to eat at but we needed to get real with ourselves... we are never going to sit at it to eat. We use it for much needed paper sorting. Thus we needed table trays. They slide easily under the couches recliners and chairs. They are black so they look great with the black furniture. You can store a pen on top for taking notes and with the rim around the whole top, nothing falls off.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Works...but...
customer_reviews.text: This table slides gracefully over carpet. However, it is not meant to hold anything heavier than perhaps a TV dinner and a drink. It is wobbly and I don't trust it to hold much over 7 pounds. Even while stationary, it wobbles if you touch the edge of it. Its just another example of cheaply made manufactured goods. I use it but I'm careful what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected, but works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Since this is a folding table, I did not expect to have to assemble the entire thing. The instructions were not great, but with half a brain you can figure it out. Also, it's not as sturdy as I would like. If you put a little too much weight on it, or lean on it even a bit, the table bends downward. I use this for eating dinner while sitting on my couch and if I have to cut up steak, or anything tougher than butter, it feels very flimsy. But overall I like the concept of the design, because it fits in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Leah E Capece

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Gosh, I bought this thing reading all the reviews of flimsy hardware and thought, “I’m sure it will be fine for my purposes”. This thing is a total piece of crap. It has made me angry! I honestly threw it on the ground and then threw it in the garage. I hate you table mate
customer_reviews.author: ReviewerJ

customer_reviews.title: Don’t believe the advertising....commercials are professional, but not real.
customer_reviews.text: What i liked best was the hype before getting the tables. Then I found out stacking them didn’t work, unless you had lots of room BEHIND your sofa. Our sofa backs up to the wall. The table legs need to go under the sofa or they’ll tip over. And, you can slide them under the sofa, but that means taking them apart. Save the instructions because you need to reconstruct them every time you bring them out. We made the mistake of trying to make it work for two days too long. Now, they are in the garbage. We live in Las Vegas, so we know how to make bad bets. Product is garbage and that’s where they went.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Rayman

customer_reviews.title: Decent table - kinda wobbly, untilted setting leans forward
customer_reviews.text: It's not the best table, it's not the worst table. It is nice that it folds and can be put away easily, but I've had this table for 3 months and the untilted (middle) setting leans forward to the point where I can't trust placing drinks on it. I don't use it every day since I work from home in another room, but sometimes we use it to eat or occasionally have a laptop used on it. I feel like it's a little too expensive for the quality. I've been preferring the cheap tv dinner tables we have from Walmart over this one now.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Jay

customer_reviews.title: Decent Foldup TV table
customer_reviews.text: As far as sturdiness goes, it does the job. Meant only for using as TV table. Not meant for anything heavier. It was easy to assemble, just a few minutes. Not easy to fold. Trying to "unhook" the support lever to get the table top to fold down is not easy at all. Does a good job of staying put, too good. Still like the table though. Use it to place by tablet on to read books and it can be pulled up close if sitting in the chair which is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: DeborahC

customer_reviews.title: Nice light weight choice
customer_reviews.text: I am changing previous review to this as we have the missing part being sent to us. This tray is very sturdy while being light weight so we can easily put up when needed & then put away. Only improvement would be if when folded, legs locked in to place if you have no place to store flat. We are using a cable tie to hold them when storing. Great solution for or new TV room and like the size of the tray top- roomy!
customer_reviews.author: LindaK

customer_reviews.title: Looks cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Its just ‘ok’. Super easy to assemble. It is a bit wobblely like other reviews mentioned. My biggest gripe is that it doesn’t look very good. We have a nice house, and the trays just have a flimsy cheap plastic appearance to them. They definitely don’t belong in any ‘nice’ areas of the house. They are better suited for the kids bed rooms, basement, or bonus room areas. I’ll have to purchase something else to use in the living room and ‘main’ areas of the house as these things are far too cheap looking to leave out where company can see them. Otherwise they seem to function as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Biolizard

customer_reviews.title: Convenient side table
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. Convenient small table for bed side. My son loves it. He uses it for school books or lap top. I would have given it 5 stars but I feel the legs are not very sturdy, kinda wabbles a bit when being used. So I gave it 4. I would not recommend placing anything heavy on top, I dont think it will hold up. But overall it's good and convenient for what he uses it for and value for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: P Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Tray is flimsy for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I expected the table tray to be made fairly sturdy for the cost and I am disappointed. It bends very easily and already appears to be warping somewhat after only a few months. The cup holder will not accommodate anything but a real small cup which makes it practically useless. The only plus features are the adjustable heights/angles and the ability to slide it very close to you. Overall, not very happy with this tray.
customer_reviews.author: Guitarman14

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: It seems like they made a change to how they manufacture or construct these tables as this new one isn’t nearly as strong and sturdy as the same model I bought last year. It’s easy to put together but whenever I set anything on it it’s very wobbly so I wouldn’t want to use it for a laptop or anything important. It’s strange because it looks identical to the one I already had but my old is heavier and much more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The table is easy to assemble. The table top does not stay in place, it does not click in. When I need to move the table it collapses and closes. It is filmy and actually a piece of junk, I'm surprised at Amazon. I threw away the box otherwise I would return it for something more sturdy. I’m not using it anymore as I’m tired of picking up plates and food from the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good size, spacious table.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice size, large tables which seem hard to find these days for some reason. Most of them out there are too small. They are pretty stable and don't wobble around too much like the wooden ones do. The only negative is they are a little tricky to break down and set back up. You have to wrestle with them a little but over time with enough practice, that will hopefully become easier. We have only had them for a short time. You can also set them at and incline or angle for reading or using a laptop or some such device.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Marks

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.text: I like the design of this table, it's great that it can slide all the way under a chair, couch or bed. For that use it works well. However, the table is pretty flimsy, it cant bear much weight. I know Mama told us to keep our elbows off the table but sometimes I still do. The whole table flexes with the weight of just my arms resting on it. The cup holder is completely useless, no cups even fit into it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for an RV!
customer_reviews.text: Work great as a tv tray at a sofa! Also angles easily to use as a drawing table etc. 2 work especially well in my son's RV under his sofa to creat additional eating space for his kids who also like to draw, paint, be creative! Stows easily in the rv when not in use. The cup holders are kinda small, aren't used and might be considered in the way but no other complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Giveawag
